DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: BARLETTA, M.;Mário Barletta;Barletta, M.;Barletta, Mário;BARLETTA, MARIO;BARLETTA, M;BARLETTA, MÃiRIO

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Marine ecologist, Full Professor at Oceanography Department of Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE), in Recife/Pernambuco/ Brazil. Responsible for the lecturing of disciplines as Marine Nekton and Ecology of Estuarine Ecosystems at both under graduation and pos-graduation levels. Registered as Masters and Doctorate supervisor at the Oceanography Pos-Graduation Program (UFPE), and at the Ecology Pos-Graduation Program at Nacional University of Colombia (Medellín). Research interests are on estuarine and coastal ecology, experimental design for hypothesis testing and data handling for ecological studies and pollution on marine wildlife. Since 2015, Associate Editor of Frontiers (specialty section of Frontiers in Marine and Environmental Science) (Springer Nature Publishing Group - www.frontiers.org).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Marine ecologist, Full Professor at Oceanography Department of Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE), in Recife/Pernambuco/ Brazil. Registered as Masters and Doctorate supervisor at the Oceanography Pos-Graduation Program (UFPE), and at the Ecology Pos-Graduation Program at Nacional University of Colombia (Medellín). Research interests are on estuarine and coastal ecology, experimental design for hypothesis testing and data handling for ecological studies and pollution on marine wildlife. Since 2015, Associate Editor of Frontiers (specialty section of Frontiers in Marine and Environmental Science) (Springer Nature Publishing Group - www.frontiers.org).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Ecologia de peixes do estuário da baia de Paranaguá
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto é parte do tema desenvolvido no Pós-Doutorado. O objetivo principal era estudar a importância deste ecossitema para as espácies de peixes estuarinos e marinhos. Com os resultados obtidos está sendo realizada uma comparação com os resultados do estuário do Rio Caeté (PA, Norte do Brasil).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Ecologia do estuário do Rio Goiana (Pernambuco/Paraíba - Brasil)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto tem por objetivo estudar a ecologia das assembléias de peixes do estuário do Rio Goiana (Pernambuco/Paraíba) e sua interação com os diferentes habitats existentes nesse estuário e nas áreas adjacentes. Além disso, esse projeto tem também por objetivo avaliar a contaminação das espécies de vertebrados e invertebrados, por metais pesados.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Comparação entre estuários do Indo-Oeste Pacifico e Atlântico Ocidental
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este estudo tem por objetivo apresentar uma metodologia para se comparar estuários de diferentes regiões do Mundo. Os estuários utilisados nessa primeira comparação foram: Estuario do Rio Caeté (Região Norte do Brasil) e Estuario do Rio Embley (Região Norte da Australia). Os parâmetros utilizados para essa comparação foram: os grupos funcionais que usam os diferentes habitats, o modo alimentar e a diversidade taxonomica.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Avaliação da atividade pesqueira e a importância dos principais habitats do estuário para as diferentes fases de desenvolvimento de peixes: Estuário do Rio Goiana (Resex Acaú/Goiana - PE/PB/ICMBio).
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto aqui proposto faz parte de uma série de outros projetos de pesquisa que vêm sendo desenvolvidos pelo grupo de pesquisa desde 2005. Desse conjunto fazem parte projetos de pesquisa sobre a ecologia de peixes, poluição por plásticos, metais pesados e a exploração da Anomalocardia brasiliana por comunidades tradicionais do entorno do estuário. O grupo de pesquisa conta hoje com um extenso banco de informações sobre o local de estudo, e pretende dar continuidade a coleta e análise de dados em médio/longo prazo no mesmo local. O estuário do Rio Goiana, no Nordeste do Brasil, recebe águas de uma pequena bacia hidrográfica que corta principalmente o Agreste e a Zona da Mata pernambucano. Dessa bacia, de recursos hídricos limitados, dependem diretamente atividades econômicas, desde o abastecimento da população e indústrias, até a conservação de recursos vivos na região costeira adjacente. A avaliação e melhoria da qualidade da água sob todos os seus aspectos, inclusive concentrações de metais e outros elementos-traço, é por isso fundamental para a manutenção adequada de seus serviços ecológicos. Dentre os serviços ecológicos prestados pelo estuário destacam-se aqueles relacionados à preservação da integridade da sua área estuarina e das comunidades biológicas que dela dependem. Também é importante ressaltar a manutenção, por parte deste estuário, de uma comunidade pesqueira a qual explora recursos estuarinos e costeiros como peixes (de valor comercial e para subsistência), moluscos e crustáceos. Baseado nessas informações, este estudo tem por objetivo determinar a produtividade pesqueira do estuário e sua área costeira adjacente explorada pela frota pesqueira artesanal, determinar a importância dos diferentes habitats do estuário do Rio Goiana para as diferentes fases ontogenéticas dessas espécies de peixes, e os padrões de movimento da ictiofauna entre estes habitats, através da análise dos isótopos estáveis de Carbono e Nitrogênio (13C e 15N). Al
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Avaliação da atividade pesqueira e a importância dos principais habitats do estuário para as diferentes fases de desenvolvimento de peixes: Estuário do Rio Goiana (Resex Acaú/Goiana - PE/PB/ICMBio).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Mercúrio em compartimentos ambientais de estuários tropicais
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Objetivos e metas alcançados
Objetivos: determinar as variações espaciais e temporais das concentrações de mercúrio total ao longo da teia trófica do estuário e região costeira do rio Goiana (Pernambuco), com ênfase nos peixes de importância comercial, considerando ainda suas fases ontogenéticas e ecologia alimentar.

Objetivos específicos:
- triar (biometria, analise de conteúdo estomacal e dissecção) pelo menos 350 peixes das espécies de interesse; 
- liofilizar e preservar os tecidos resultantes da triagem;
- enviar 350 amostras para análise de mercúrio total no laboratório parceiro;
- realizar análises estatísticas reunindo as informações biológicas, ecológicas e ambientais disponíveis para cada grupo de amostras.
- determinar quais fatores influenciam as concentrações de mercúrio total em peixes provenientes das atividades pesqueiras artesanais do estuário do rio Goiana.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Mercúrio em compartimentos ambientais de estuários tropicais

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Transferência Trófica de Microplásticos em Comunidades de Peixes de um Estuário Tropical
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Estuaries are extremely productive ecosystems that offer a number of assets and environmental services. However, anthropogenic interference in these ecosystems usually result in loses that affect directly the fauna across different trophic levels. One of the most conspicuous forms of interference is pollution by plastic wastes. Once feral, plastics fragment into smaller particles that eventually reach the size of microplastics (<5mm). In addition to this source, studies revealed that fisheries (including the wear and tear of gear) and domestic effluents (fibres) produce a large amount of microfilaments that also reach estuaries. The main source of microplastics to estuaries are river basins, followed by autochthonous sources, and from there they reach the sea. Microplastics present high densities in estuaries, where they become easily available for the biota. Among these organism are fish, which have different feeding habits and habitats uses, depending on the ontogenetic phase and seasonal influences. If one of the phases within the life cycle of a fish species lives or uses an estuarine habitat at the same time when it is highly contaminated by microplastics, the chances of interactions increase significantly. Interactions include not only the direct ingestion of microplastics, but must also consider the shifting patterns of feeding habits along ontogeny. When feeding, fish may pray on dietary items previously contaminated. Contamination usually increases towards the top of the food chain, and higher trophic levels are more contaminated by microplastics, especially developed phases that prey on larger, whole, items. The trophic transference on microplastics along food chains of the Goiana Estuary is already being explored, and top predators show higher contamination levels in their later phases that prey on whole fishes. The ingestion of microplastics by species of economic and social interest might become a public health issue if microplastics have adsorbed pollutants available in the environment onto their surfaces before ingestion. This project, that was started with the help of CNPq (405818/2012-2/COAGR/PESCA e 404931/2016-2), aims at assessing microplastics ingestion patterns (number, shape, colour etc.) by different fishes as a function of onthogenetic phase (juvenile, sub-adult, adult), salinity gradient (upper, middle, lower estuary) and, seasonal variations (dry and rainy periods). In addition, it will study if microplastics ingestion vary according with trophic level, independent of habitat use and time of the year.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Ecology of microplastics (MPs) and Total Mercury (T-Hg) contamination within food webs of estuarine and coastal ecosystems around the world
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The water column of Goiana Estuary (Northeast Brazil) was examined for the seasonal and spatial variation of MPs and their quantification relative to zooplankton, demersal fish species contamination following the same sampling design. The density of MPs in the water column determines their bioavailability. Interest in studies on MPs and T-Hg distribution in relation to spatial and temporal variation of environmental factors and fauna are increasing in quantity and quality. If the ecological strategies utilised in Goiana Estuary were replicated in others estuaries, comparisons could be made in order to describe how the estuarine ecosystems work around the world. Standard protocols for sampling, extraction, enumeration and classification of MPs, T-Hg and others pollutant ingested by fishes have been developed and are presented here to encourage comparisons. Standardized and comparable sampling designs and laboratory procedures are an important strategy in order to devise and transfer managerial solutions among different sites and comparisons along time when studying the same environment.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Ecologia trófica e da contaminação por Microplásticos (MPs) e por mercúrio (T-Hg) em ecossistemas Estuarinos e Costeiros
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Espera-se, obter com a padronização do esforço amostral e delineamento amostral desenvolvido em nossos estudos detectar padrões das condições de contaminação por Mps e T-Hg, levando em consideração situações sazonais (estações seca e chuvosa) características e a influência direta e indireta da precipitação e da flutuação do gradiente de salinidade. Entender como e quais as variáveis oceanográficas que agem localmente e podem ser agente de melhora ou piora nas condições da qualidade da água; comparar os níveis de contaminação ao longo do tempo, observando o comportamento da qualidade das espécies de peixes estudadas e a tendência para possíveis cenários futuros; associar eventos resultantes de atividades humanas (principalmente urbanização) à melhora, piora ou manutenção da qualidade dos rios; melhorar a acessibilidade da comunidade a um dado existente, trazendo novas associações e interpretações; assim como assistir aos tomadores de decisão sobre os potenciais efeitos de intervenções que possivelmente ocasionem o declínio da balneabilidade das águas, servir de apoio e embasamento científico para controle e gestão, como também para projetos ligados à conservação ambiental, que tenham por princípio fundamental a qualidade da água (ex. esgotamento sanitário). A partir do desenvolvimento do trabalho também é esperada a produção de pelo menos três publicações, onde a tese será escrita em formato de artigos: o primeiro correspondente a ecologia trófica e da contaminação por T-Hg, que seria uma análise de duas espécies simpatricas consumidoras secundaria. E um outro estudo que está sendo realizado é sobre contaminação de elasmobrânquios capturados na região costeira. A padronização do esforço e do delineamento amostral já é adotado por outros entes políticos, como por exemplo, a União Europeia onde se padronizou as metodologias e relatórios de forma a promover oportunidades de comparações entre agências. Com isso, comparações poderiam ser realizadas com mais precisão.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: It is expected that, with the standardization of the sampling effort and sampling design developed in our studies, detect patterns of contamination conditions by Mps and T-Hg, taking into account seasonal situations (dry and rainy season) characteristics and the direct and indirect influence of precipitation and the fluctuation of the salinity gradient. Understand how and which oceanographic variables act locally and can be an agent of improvement or worsening in water quality conditions; compare the contamination levels over time, observing the quality behavior of the studied fish species and the trend towards possible future scenarios; associate events resulting from human activities (mainly urbanization) with the improvement, deterioration or maintenance of river quality; improve community accessibility to existing data, bringing new associations and interpretations; as well as assisting decision makers on the potential effects of interventions that could possibly cause the decline of bathing water, serve as support and scientific basis for control and management, as well as for projects related to environmental conservation, which have quality as a fundamental principle. of water (eg sanitary sewage). From the development of the work, the production of at least three publications is also expected, where the thesis will be written in article format: the first corresponding to trophic ecology and T-Hg contamination, which would be an analysis of two sympatric consumer species secondary. And another study that is being carried out is on the contamination of elasmobranchs captured in the coastal region. The standardization of effort and sampling design is already adopted by other political entities, such as the European Union, where methodologies and reports were standardized in order to promote opportunities for comparisons between agencies. With this, comparisons could be made more accurately.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: ): Ecology of microplastics (MPs) and Total Mercury (T-Hg) contamination within food webs of estuarine and coastal ecosystems

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Transferência Trófica de Microplásticos e Biomagnificação de Metais Pesados em Comunidades de Peixes do Estuário do Rio Goiana ? Reserva Extrativista Pernambuco/Paraíba.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A coluna de água do canal principal do Estuário do Rio Goiana (Nordeste do Brasil) foi examinada para se estudar a variação sazonal e espacial de microplasticos (MPs) e sua quantificação em relação ao zooplâncton, contaminação de espécies demersais de peixes seguindo o mesmo desenho amostral. A densidade de MPs na coluna de água determina sua biodisponibilidade. O interesse por estudos sobre a distribuição de MPs e T-Hg em relação à variação espacial e temporal de fatores ambientais e faunísticos está aumentando em quantidade e qualidade. O principal objetivo deste estudo é modelar a cadeia alimentar estuarina (e.g. contaminação por transferência de MPs e bioacumulação e biomagnificação de T-Hg) em relação aos padrões espaço-temporais de utilização do habitat, ecologia alimentar e agente contaminante. Além disso,se as estratégias ecológicas utilizadas no Estuário Goiana fossem replicadas em outros estuários, comparações poderiam ser feitas a fim de descrever como funcionam os ecossistemas estuarinos.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The water column of the main channel of the Goiana River Estuary (Northeast Brazil) was examined to study the seasonal and spatial variation of microplastics (PMs) and their quantification in relation to zooplankton, contamination of demersal fish species following the same design sampling. The density of PMs in the water column determines their bioavailability. Interest in studies on the distribution of PMs and T-Hg in relation to the spatial and temporal variation of environmental and faunal factors is increasing in quantity and quality. The main objective of this study is to model the estuarine food chain (e.g. contamination by PM transfer and T-Hg bioaccumulation and biomagnification) in relation to spatiotemporal patterns of habitat use, food ecology and contaminant. Furthermore, if the ecological strategies used in the Goiana Estuary were replicated in other estuaries, comparisons could be made in order to describe how estuarine ecosystems work.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Trophic Transfer of Microplastics and Biomagnification of Heavy Metals in Fish Communities in the Goiana River Estuary ? Pernambuco/Paraíba Extractive Reserve.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: El papel de la salinidad en las asociaciones de larvas en Bahía de Málaga: valoración de la importancia de esa área como sala-cuna y comparación con otros estuarios en habitats tropicales.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
?El papel de la salinidad en las asociaciones de larvas en Bahía Málaga: valoración de la importancia de esa área como sala-cuna y comparación con otros estuarios en hábitats tropicales?.
Lugar: Sala de reuniones Invemar Sede Pacífico, CIAT.
Asistentes: Jaime Cantera, Alejandra Ocampo, Alan Giraldo (Universidad del Valle); Mario Barletta (Universidad de Pernambuco); Gustavo Castellanos (Universidad de Bremen); David Alonso, Oscar David Solano, Diana Isabel Gómez, Hernando Hurtado y Luz Marina Mejía (Invemar).
Objetivo del Taller: Presentar proyecto aprobado por Colciencias y ajustar algunos aspectos metodológicos y de articulación interinstitucional.
RESUMEN
A nivel mundial se reconoce la importancia de los estuarios para las pesquerías ya que se ha demostrado que una gran parte de los asentamientos de larvas y juveniles alrededor del mundo de la mayoría de las especies se realizan en aguas estuarinas (Barletta et al., 1998). Las áreas estuarinas y aguas bajas en regiones tropicales y subtropicales son también consideradas como áreas de sala-cuna de muchos invertebrados y especies de peces (Barletta et al., 2003). Los estuarios presentan funciones ecológicas fundamentales como lugares de reproducción y desarrollo temprano de especies de importancia económica y ecológica, al brindar alta disponibilidad de hábitats para refugio y alimentación. Esos sistemas cumplen una función de salacuna "nursery" de los estadíos de vida vulnerable de organismos marinos (EVVOM), como lo son las larvas, los juveniles y las hembras ovígeras. Por otra parte, los cambios medioambientales influyen en que las especies migren en respuesta a cambios de salinidad o temperatura, moviéndose hacia y dentro del estuario (Barletta et al., 2003). Bahía Málaga, ubicada en la costa del Pacífico vallecaucano, es un sistema estuarino dinámico reconocido por su compleja estructura de ecosistemas, intrincados ensamblajes de su macrofauna, la alta diversidad de biotopos y la gran riqueza en fauna y f

Specialty section of Frontiers in Marine Science and Frontiers in Environmental Science (Marine Ecology and Marine Pollution) as an open access, peer-reviewed publisher, Frontiers (www.frontiersin.org) brings an innovative and constructive approach to academic publishing. Frontiers has been created by scientists for scientists, so that we can take responsibility for how we want our research reviewed and published. As Associate Editor, Dr. Barletta play an integral part in the collaborative Frontiers review process, handling manuscripts submitted to your specialty and ensuring their fair, rigorous and transparent review. The Frontiers peer-review is the first real-time interactive review system in publishing - it is fast, thorough, and rewarding.www.frontiersin.org

Research Topic: Aquatic Habitat Ecology & Conservation: Continental and Marine Ecosystems Connectivity

The ?Aquatic Habitat Conservation in South America? Symposium occurred during the XXI Brazilian Society of Ichthyology Meeting. The proceedings were published as a special issue in the Journal of Fish Biology (vol. 89, Number 1, June 2016). In this special issue, authors provided an analytical overview of problems faced by the conservation of fishes and aquatic habitats of South America. Habitat loss emerged as the greatest concern for all South American aquatic ecosystems, with a long list of causes related to unsustainable development models. 

Based on this finding, we would like to extend this topic to other continents, different climates, fauna and flora around the world. Our goal is to provide a comprehensive and multidisciplinary overview of variables that influence flora and fauna distributions and shape their ecological interactions within aquatic ecosystems. 

Thereby, this Research Topic aims to provide a discussion forum to better understand the factors that lead to the loss of aquatic habitats and its effect on aquatic communities and ecosystem functioning, as well as the efforts being made to promote restoration of these ecosystems. 

All topics related to aquatic habitat (marine and freshwater) ecology and conservation are therefore welcome. Local studies, as well as national and international efforts, to preserve and restore the functionality of aquatic ecosystems are invited and can be presented in the form of current research methods and findings, review articles, opinion pieces or expanded case studies and pilot programs designed to better understand the best practices of aquatic ecosystems management and restoration.

https://www.frontiersin.org/research-topics/6705/aquatic-habitat-ecology-conservation-continental-and-marine-ecosystems-connectivity

Request for Proposal Review in the topic Marine Sciences 

Title: PLASTIPOLL ? EFFECTS OF MICROPLASTICS AND ADSORBED EMERGING POLLUTANTS IN AIPTASIA: A MODEL SYMBIOTIC MARINE INVERTEBRATE

 

By:


Portuguese Principal Investigator:

Miguel Leal, MARE ? Marine and Environmental Sciences Centre, University of Lisbon

Ricardo Calado, CESAM ? University of Aveiro

 

Israeli Principal Investigator:

Ariel Kushmaro, Ben Gurion University

Esti Kramarsky-Winter, Ben Gurion University

 

 

There are currently 6,350 to 245,000 million metric tons of plastic in the world?s oceans. This plastic is constantly breaking down into smaller particles that float in the water column and sink to the benthos. It is, therefore, critical to assess single and combined impacts of microplastics, microbial biofilms and emerging pollutants (such as the chemical sunscreen oxybenzone) on the physiological performance and health of model marine organisms. As an important step towards the understanding of the effects of microplastics on the marine ecosystem, we will assess the single and combined effects of microplastics, adsorbed microbial communities and the emerging pollutant oxybenzone on the physiology of a model benthic marine invertebrate-dinoflagellate symbiosis: the photosynthetic glass anemone Aiptasia. Both Israeli and Portuguese parties will examine the environmental levels of these materials in order to expose Aiptasia to environmentally relevant doses of microplastics and adherents under carefully controlled experimental conditions. The resulting effects will be monitored both in Israel and Portugal and, at the end of the experimental period, the health and reproductive status of model organisms will be assessed. Changes in microbial communities on and within Aiptasia will be examined using molecular tools and headed by the Israeli group. Changes in the lipidomic profile of Aiptasia and its endosymbiotic dinoflagellates, as well as ecotoxicological endp

Call, due to his recognized prestige and career as a researcher and expert in the field of your specialty.
The objective of the Call is to encourage science to develop novel ideas, models, concepts and methodologies for the comprehension of phenomena, processes and realities to achieve substantial progress in the scientific knowledge. One of the strategic axes of CONACYT is to support the Mexican scientific community to develop investigation to account for the conceptual progress on every field of science, including the social sciences and humanities.
Your participation in this evaluation process has a great relevance for CONACYT because this will allow us to choose the best proposals in accordance to their scientific quality and pertinence. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Ecología de la contaminación por microplásticos y metales pesados en el estuario de de la cuenca Quilca-Chili, Arequipa - Perú
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Actualmente el cambio climático, la contaminación por microplásticos (MPs) y metales pesados generados por las
actividades antropogénicas, afectan a los ecosistemas acuáticos como los estuarios y sus regiones colindantes.
Investigaciones realizadas en América del Sur revelaron una falta de conocimiento del tema en la costa peruana. Este
proyecto se enfocará en el ecosistema estuarial que viene sufriendo el impacto urbano e industrial, por las cuencas
hidrográficas que llevaran a la acumulación de los contaminantes mencionados. El estuario de la cuenca Quilca-Chili,
provincia de Camaná, no es ajeno a la falta de información mencionada, influyendo en la red trófica compuesta por
productores primarios (fitoplancton), consumidores secundarios (zooplancton) y consumidores terciarios (peces, aves y
mamíferos) que habitan en este ecosistema. Por lo expuesto, se va correlacionar la variación estacional y los parámetros
fisicoquímicos en relación de la densidad de MPs y concentración de metales pesados (Hg, Cu, As, Cr y Cd) en
sedimentos, columna de agua, invertebrados marinos y peces en sus diferentes fases ontogénicas. Para esto se
realizarán muestreos de campo, analizaremos muestras biológicas y emplearemos análisis estadísticos para conocer los
efectos estacionales-espaciales en la concentración de contaminantes sobre las diferentes fases ontogénicas de la red
trófica del ecosistema estuarino del río Quilca. Estos resultados presentarán el primer estudio de ecología de la
contaminación del estuario del río Quilca y se van a comparar con estudios realizados en América del Sur.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BARLETTA, M.;Mário Barletta;Barletta, M.;Barletta, Mário;BARLETTA, MARIO;BARLETTA, M;BARLETTA, MÃiRIO

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Ecología Trófica Y contaminacón por Microplásticos (MPs) Y mercúrio (T-Hg) de Diferentes fases Ontogenéticas de Mugil cephalus (Linnaeus, 1758 en el Estuário de Quilca, Arequipa - Perú
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Los microplásticos y otros contaminantes como los metales pesados están presentes en todos los ecosistemas y se ,registran elevadas concentraciones de los mismos en los estuarios y ambientes costeros cercanos a estos. El presente estudio se enfoca en la ecología trófica de la especie Mugil cephalus, considerada una especie indicadora importante de la salud de los ecosistemas costeros, en la zona costera-estuarina de la desembocadura de la cuenca Quilca-Chili, en el cual se identificará la variación estacional del hábitat y de la dieta de las distintas fases ontogenéticas de la especie, para finalmente determinar su grado de contaminación por microplásticos y mercurio, con el fin de evaluar el impacto ecológico de estos contaminantes. El muestreo se llevará a cabo durante doce meses y se correlacionará las variables ambientales con las concentraciones de mercurio y microplásticos en los individuos muestreados, lo que permitirá conocer la calidad de este recurso pesquero para la región de Arequipa y su susceptibilidad a la contaminación.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BARLETTA, M.;Mário Barletta;Barletta, M.;Barletta, Mário;BARLETTA, MARIO;BARLETTA, M;BARLETTA, MÃiRIO

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Com o objetivo de reforçar seu papel como centro de pensamento e de promoção do conhecimento científico e tecnológico, a Academia Brasileira de Ciências (ABC) optou por instituir um Grupo de Trabalho que possa apontar a sua posição frente ao tema " Contaminação por microplásticos e nanoplásticos". O Prof. Mario esta co-coordenando esse grupo junto com Prof. Adalberto Val (membro titular da ABC).

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Beach Environmental Quality - Water quality monitoring programs at recreational beaches in Brazil.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International workshop on beach ecowatch program. Boracay Island, Philipines.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Summary

This paper applyes the concept of ecosystem health to recreational beaches taking into consideration water quality regarding microbiological contamination. Monitoring programs and certification systems are also briefly discussed from the point of view of their microbiological contamination component. The advantages and disadvantages of each type of initiative are highlighted. A new concept for water quality monitoring (from sample design to data interpretation) for microbiological contamination is suggested. The present situation of the Brazilian monitoring programs of coastal waters for microbiological contamination is presented and commented. The case of Boa Viagem and Pina beaches, in Recife, is presented and briefly analyzed. Conclusions are drawn from the topics discussed and suggestions for improving the monitoring programs in Brazil, and new programs elsewhere, are made.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Seasonal changes in density, biomass, and diversity of estuarine fishes in tidal mangrove creeks of the lower Caeté Estuary (northern Brazilian coast, east Amazon)

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Autoecologia de Peixes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present study investigated the fish assemblage in an intertidal mangrove forest during high tide in a macro tide region. Moreover, this study describes the seasonal changes of the fish composition in relation to biomass, density and species number in tidal creeks of the Furo do Meio. A total of 29,107 individuals weighing 526,240g (total density 0.11 ind. m-2 and total biomass of 2.1 g m-2) were captured with a block net, distributed among 26 families and 49 species. Analysis of catch data showed that the number of species varied significantly between creeks and the total fish biomass differed significantly between seasons. In addition, for the two most important species (Cathorops pleurops and Colomesus psittacus) densities and biomass were significantly different between seasons. The densities and biomass of C. pleurops, P. atherinoides, P. nodosus and S. naso showed significant temporal differences. Significant differences between creeks were observed for density and biomass of Anchovia clupeoides and Rhinosardinia amazonica. The ABC plots for the fish fauna in the creeks of the Furo do Meio showed, that at the beginning of the rainy season, the dominant species increased in number and weight. Between March and April rainfall increased and as a result, salinity dropped to values between 6 and 8 psu. At this time the dominant species represented more than 60% of the total biomass and density. Therefore a reduction of diversity Hill?s index (N1) was registered, whereas, number of species (N0) and eveness (E2) showed no changes. After April rainfall decreased and biomass and density showed similar trends like before the rainy season. The number of species recorded, the density and biomass in the mangrove tidal creeks are compared with published data from other tropical and subtropical estuaries in the world. The results are also discussed in relation to the different levels of estuarine dependence for the most important species captured in the tidal creeks of

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The role of salinity in structuring the fish assemblages in a tropical estuary

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Metodos Estatisticos Aplicados ao estudo de Comunidades de Peixes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Intertidal mangrove forests, open water channels and adjacent marine areas are considered important spawning grounds and nursery areas for estuarine and marine fishes. The present study describes the seasonal changes of the fish species composition in three areas of the main channel of the Caeté River Estuary. The fish faunas of each habitat differed in density, biomass and species composition. Mean fish density and biomass for the Caeté River Estuary channel was 2000 ind. ha-1 and 9 kg ha-1 respectively. Analysis of catch data showed that the number of species, total density and total biomass differed significantly between areas and seasons. For the most important species the mean density of Cathorops spixii, Aspredinichthys filamentosus, Aspredo sp.2, Pimelodus blochii, Pseudauchnipterus nodosus and Macrodon ancylodon, differed significantly between seasons except for Stellifer rastrifer, Stellifer microps, Aspredo aspredo, Aspredo sp.1 and Cynoscion acoupa. The mean biomass of these species, with exception of S. microps and Aspredo sp.1, also differed significantly between seasons. In the Caeté Estuary seasonal salinity fluctuations appear to be the main factor that structures the fish assemblage in the entire estuarine system. At least 85 % of the species captured by the artisanal and subsistence fisheries in the Bragantine region require estuarine conditions to complete their life cycle.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Structure and Seasonal Dynamics of Larval Fish in the Caeté River Estuary in North Brazil
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Structure and Seasonal Dynamics of Larval Fish in the Caeté River Estuary in North Brazil

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Sin e Autoecologia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The larval fish assemblage was examined along a salinity gradient of the Caete´ River Estuary situated in northern Brazil. A total of 35 555 larvae, representing 28 families and 63 taxa were collected in samples taken monthly between July 1996 and September 1997, with a mean concentration of 9 individuals per 100 m3. Sciaenidae was the most abundant family comprising 46·5% (11 species) of all teleosts sampled in the Caete´ River Estuary, followed by Engraulidae (41·9%, seven species). The most abundant larval taxa were the engraulid Anchovia clupeoides and the sciaenid Stellifer microps accounting together for 70·4% of the total catch. The most abundant developmental stages of A. clupeoides was preflexion larva, confirming that this species is resident. Apart from estuarine species, the upper estuary additionally has taxa associated with freshwater conditions, whereas species with marine affinities were captured in the lower estuary. The densities of most species were influenced to a greater degree by site than by season, showing maximum densities in the
upper estuary. Larval density peaked in the upper estuary during the dry season and was lowest when freshwater discharge was at its maximum, which was attributed to an increased seaward drift of larvae. Species number was greatest in the upper estuary between the rainy and dry season.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

A total of 35 555 larvae, representing 28 families and 63 taxa were collected in samples taken monthly between July 1996 and September 1997, with a mean concentration of 9 individuals per 100 m3. Sciaenidae was the most abundant family comprising 46·5% (11 species) of all teleosts sampled in the Caete´ River Estuary, followed by Engraulidae (41·9%, seven species). The most abundant larval taxa were the engraulid Anchovia clupeoides and the sciaenid Stellifer microps accounting together for 70·4% of the total catch. The most abundant developmental stages of A. clupeoides was preflexion larva, confirming that this species is resident. Apart from estuarine species, the upper estuary additionally has taxa associated with freshwater conditions, whereas species with marine affinities were captured in the lower estuary. The densities of most species were influenced to a greater degree by site than by season, showing maximum densities in the
upper estuary. Larval density peaked in the upper estuary during the dry season and was lowest when freshwater discharge was at its maximum, which was attributed to an increased seaward drift of larvae. Species number was greatest in the upper estuary between the rainy and dry season.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Community structure and temporal variability of ichthyoplankton in North Brazilian mangrove creeks
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Community structure and temporal variability of ichthyoplankton in North Brazilian mangrove creeks

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Ecologia de Comunidades de Peixes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The species composition and dynamics of fish larvae in three mangrove creeks located in the Caete´ Estuary (north Brazil) were studied monthly using a trap net during diurnal ebb tides. A total of 109 954 larvae, representing 25 families and 54 species, were collected from October 1996 to October 1997. The community was dominated numerically by a few species, a feature common for other estuarine fish populations. The most abundant taxa were estuarine species, namely the eleotrid Guavina guavina (46·7%) and the engraulid Anchovia clupeoides (14·9%). The sciaenid Cynoscion acoupa was the only marine species that used the mangroves extensively as a nursery site, occurring mainly at the postflexion stage. The size distribution of G. guavina did not produce shifting modes, indicating continuous transport out of the mangroves by tidal currents. Significantly lower species richness was observed in the late rainy season, primarily due to the emigration of marine species. Intermediate seasons were characterized by more complex larval fish assemblages. The temporal trends of the dominant species was influenced to a great degree by their life history strategy
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The species composition and dynamics of fish larvae in three mangrove creeks located in the Caete´ Estuary (north Brazil) were studied monthly using a trap net during diurnal ebb tides. Significantly lower species richness was observed in the late rainy season, primarily due to the emigration of marine species. Intermediate seasons were characterized by more complex larval fish assemblages. The temporal trends of the dominant species was influenced to a great degree by their life history strategy

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The keystone role of leaf-removing crabs in mangrove forest of North Brazil. (Available on line)

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Interação entre os Organismos Marinhos e os Parâmetros Ambientais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Principle factors which influence mangroveleaf litter turnover, in particular therole of leaf-removing crabs, were evaluatedin a riverine mangrove site nearBragança (Pará, North Brazil). Ourspecial interest was focussed on the roleof the leaf-removing crab Ucidescordatus. Leaf litter fluxes between themangrove forest and the adjacent estuarywere investigated by estimating the biomassand fate of leaf litter material and propagules. Vegetation is dominated by Rhizophora mangle, with Avicenniagerminans trees, both up to 25 m high,found intermittently. During 1997, Rhizophora trees produced around 1.40 gDW m-2 d-1 of leave fall and0.75 g DW m-2 d-1 of propagules.Leaf decomposition rates on the ground wereabout 0.06 g DW m-2 d-1,irrespective of species, habitat or siteexposure. This amount accounts for <3%of total leaf fall. Average leaf litterbiomass present on the ground was 0.01 gDW m-2 d-1. When the mangroveforest was flooded (on average 10 days permonth) the quantity of leaf litterand propagules washed out with the springtide was 10 and 17 times greater thanduring neap tide. Nevertheless, tidalexport and decomposition together made upless than 39 percent of annual leaf litterfall. The bulk of the remaining amount isapparently removed by Ucides. Eachcrab consumed about 1.30 g DW of leaflitter material and propagules per day.Since the average density of these crabswas 1.38 crabs m-2, it is proposedthat Ucides is a keystone species inBragantinian mangroves.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Seasonal changes of density, biomass and species composition of fishes in different habitats of the Caeté Estuary (North Brazilian coast - east Amazon)
Contribution to the feeding ecology of the predatory wingfin anchovy Pterengraulis atherinoides (L.) in north Brazilian mangrove creeks
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Contribution to the feeding ecology of the predatory wingfin anchovy Pterengraulis atherinoides (L.) in north Brazilian mangrove creeks

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Interação entre os Organismos Marinhos e os Parâmetros Ambientais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Stomach contents were examined from 136 Amazonian wingfin anchovy, Pterengraulis atherinoides (Engraulidae), caught from intertidal mangrove creeks at diurnal neap tides between June and September 1997 (early dry season) near Bragança (northern Brazil). The study found that P. atherinoides are specialized predators of juvenile Natantia and Teleostei (mean: 67 and 28% by dry weight, respectively). On average, 5.2 g ha−1 day−1 of Natantia and 2.6 g ha−1 day−1 of Teleostei (wet weight) were eaten by P. atherinoides. Diet changed with fish size as well as by month. While smaller sizes still fed on several food items (e.g. the copepod Pseudiaptomus marshii, the brachyuran crab Pachygrapsus gracilis, amphipods), fish >13 cm standard length (SL) fed exclusively on Natantia and Teleostei. Copepods were especially abundant in July and August, dominating the diet of fish <9 cm SL in numbers (92%). Our results suggest a positive relationship between predator size and prey size, both in penaeid and piscine prey. However, the largest predator size class apparently selected fewer but larger Teleostei prey. More than 64% of Natantia were juvenile penaeid shrimps of commercial importance (Fenneropenaeus subtilis, F. schmitti, Xiphopenaeus kroyeri). Comparison with ichthyoplankton samples taken simultaneously showed that Sciaenidae and Mugilidae were positively selected while Gobiidae and Engraulidae were negatively selected. The presence of pranzia larvae in the stomachs of fish <10 cm SL, from July onward, suggests that these sizes fulfil a mutually beneficial 'cleaning' function on other fish. Block net sampling at neap tides showed that P. atherinoides were present in intertidal mangrove creeks throughout the submergence period, suggesting temporal optimization of the foraging time in the eulittoral.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Stomach contents were examined from 136 Amazonian wingfin anchovy, Pterengraulis atherinoides (Engraulidae), caught from intertidal mangrove creeks at diurnal neap tides between June and September 1997 (early dry season) near Bragança (northern Brazil). The study found that P. atherinoides are specialized predators of juvenile Natantia and Teleostei (mean: 67 and 28% by dry weight, respectively). Copepods were especially abundant in July and August, dominating the diet of fish <9 cm SL in numbers (92%). DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Factors affecting seasonal variations in demersal fish assemblages at an ecocline in a tropical-subtropical estuary
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Factors affecting seasonal variations in demersal fish assemblages at an ecocline in a tropical-subtropical estuary

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Interação entre os Organismos Marinhos e os Parâmetros Ambientais

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Produtos e Serviços Voltados Para A Defesa e Proteção do Meio Ambiente, Incluindo O Desenvolvimento Sustentado

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Seasonal changes of the fish species composition in terms of biomass, density and number of species in three areas of the main channel of the Paranaguá estuary (axis East-West) are described. The objective of this study was to determine the fish assemblage (number of species, density and biomass) of the Paranaguá estuary and its variation in relation to seasonal fluctuations in salinity, water temperature and dissolved oxygen in the main channel. Two hundred and thirty-four samples were collected monthly, between July/2000 and June/2001, in the main channel. Seventy-nine species of 29 families were captured with a total estimated mean density and biomass of 1,513 ind. ha-1 and 34 kg ha-1 respectively. The number of species and total mean density differed significantly among areas and seasons, but the total mean biomass differed only significantly throughout the ecocline (areas) of Paranaguá estuary. For the most abundant species the mean densities of Stellifer rastrifer, Aspistor luniscutis, Menthicirrhus americanus, Sphoeroides testudineus, Cynoscion leiarchus and Symphurus tesselatus (with the exception of Cathorops spixii and Genidens genidens), differed significantly among seasons. The mean biomass of these species, with the exception of G. genidens, S. rastrifer, A. luniscutis and S. testudineus, also differed significantly for the factor seasons. Area was a significant factor for the eight most abundant species (density and biomass), except S. testudineus (density), G. genidens, C. leiarchus and S. tesselatus (biomass). The season vs. area interaction term was significant for C. leiarchus (density). Most of these differences occurred during the rainy season when fishes concentrated principally in the middle of the estuary, where the salinity remained stable. It is suggested that, the salinity stability in the middle of the estuary is the main reason why the most estuarine resident fish species move downstream and remain there, regardless the increase of freshw
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Seasonal changes of the fish species composition in terms of biomass, density and number of species in three areas of the main channel of the Paranaguá estuary (axis East-West) are described. The objective of this study was to determine the fish assemblage (number of species, density and biomass) of the Paranaguá estuary and its variation in relation to seasonal fluctuations in salinity, water temperature and dissolved oxygen in the main channel. Two hundred and thirty-four samples were collected monthly, between July/2000 and June/2001, in the main channel. Seventy-nine species of 29 families were captured with a total estimated mean density and biomass of 1,513 ind. ha-1 and 34 kg ha-1 respectively. The number of species and total mean density differed significantly among areas and seasons, but the total mean biomass differed only significantly throughout the ecocline (areas) of Paranaguá estuary. For the most abundant species the mean densities of Stellifer rastrifer, Aspistor luniscutis, Menthicirrhus americanus, Sphoeroides testudineus, Cynoscion leiarchus and Symphurus tesselatus (with the exception of Cathorops spixii and Genidens genidens), differed significantly among seasons. The mean biomass of these species, with the exception of G. genidens, S. rastrifer, A. luniscutis and S. testudineus, also differed significantly for the factor seasons. Area was a significant factor for the eight most abundant species (density and biomass), except S. testudineus (density), G. genidens, C. leiarchus and S. tesselatus (biomass). The season vs. area interaction term was significant for C. leiarchus (density). Most of these differences occurred during the rainy season when fishes concentrated principally in the middle of the estuary, where the salinity remained stable. It is suggested that, the salinity stability in the middle of the estuary is the main reason why the most estuarine resident fish species move downstream and remain there, regardless the increase of freshw

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Endogenous Activity Rhythms of larval fish assemblages in a mangrovefringed estuary in North Brazil.
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Endogenous activity rhythms of larval fish assemblages in a mangrove-fringed estuary in North Brazil.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Interação entre os Organismos Marinhos e os Parâmetros Ambientais

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Produtos e Serviços Voltados Para A Defesa e Proteção do Meio Ambiente, Incluindo O Desenvolvimento Sustentado

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In Caeté Estuary, the decrease of larval abundance downstream was attributed to reduced retention, since ebb tide densities prevailed mainly in the middle and lower estuary during rainy season due to increased freshwater outflow. Anchovia clupeoides, Stellifer microps and Guavina guavina were most abundant in the late dry season on flood tides in the upper estuary, whereas ebb tide densities of these species prevailed in other regions. Environmental fluctuations associated with lunar periodicity, such as tidal amplitude, may account for weekly variability of recruitment and reproduction of some fish species. A. clupeoides showed increased spawning activity during first quarter moon, whereas new moon phases seemed to be reproduction periods of Cynoscion acoupa. Vertical migration was not employed by most abundant species to enable river retention, since larval densities of these species were not significantly higher at the bottom on ebb tides, except for C. acoupa and Stellifer rastrifer. This result may be related to the system turbulence or to the dominance of younger stages unable to migrate vertically at the time of sampling. Lateral movement to the river bank is proposed as a possible retention mechanism. Dial effects on larval abundance related to trophic activity and gear avoidance.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Comparison of fish assemblages and guilds in tropical habitats of the Embley (Indo-West Pacific) and Caeté (Western Atlantic) estuaries
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Comparison of fish assemblages and guilds in tropical habitats of the Embley (Indo-West Pacific) and Caeté (Western Atlantic) estuaries

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Interação entre os Organismos Marinhos e os Parâmetros Ambientais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Fish assemblages of two tropical estuaries are compared with regard to taxonomic structure and functional guilds using biomass data from different habitats of the Embley estuary (north Australia) and the Caeté estuary (north Brazil). First, the similarity of the habitats of the two estuaries was compared using taxonomic classification of their respective ichthyofauna. Important taxonomic differences between the two estuaries emerged: the Neotropical fish species of the upper Caeté estuary have no equivalents in the Embley estuary, and the diverse chondrichthyan fauna of the Embley have no equivalents in the Caeté estuary. On the other hand, the more ubiquitous families Engraulidae, Sciaenidae, Ariidae, Carangidae, Haemulidae, and Clupeidae, which were characteristic of the main channel and mangrove tidal creeks of the Caeté estuary, showed 70% similarity with the main channel of the Embley estuary. Second, the similarity of the fish assemblages was compared in terms of ecological guilds (estuarine use and feeding mode). For the Embley estuary, marine immigrants (mainly piscivorous and benthophagous) were the dominant functional guild, whereas in the Caeté estuary, the estuarine functional guild (mainly benthophagous) contributed more than 50% of the biomass in each habitat. Factorial analysis of species functional guilds shows that the first factorial axis was formed positively by the dominant fish species which spend part of their life cycle in Embley estuary habitats, principally in the main channel, tidal channel (anadromous/piscivorous, marine immigrants/piscivorous, benthophagous, detritivorous and marine stragglers/piscivorous), and negatively by dominant estuarine (planktivorous and benthophagous) fish species which spend their life in the seagrass beds and in the mangrove intertidal creeks. The second factorial axis best represented the distribution of fish species in the estuary (upper, middle and lower). It is more evident in the Caeté than in the Embley

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Seasonal differences in mercury accumulation in Trichiurus lepturus (Cutlassfish) in relation to length and weight in a Northeast Brazilian estuary estuary
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Seasonal differences in mercury accumulation in Trichiurus lepturus (Cutlassfish) in relation to length and weight in a Northeast Brazilian estuary estuary

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Environmental Science and Pollution Research International

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Background, aim, and scope At tropical latitudes, and especially on the semi-arid coasts of the Brazilian Northeast, the rainfall regime governs the water quality of estuaries due to the pronounced difference between the rainy and dry seasons. These changes may be responsible for seasonal changes in bioavailability of mercury (Hg) and other pollutants to the estuarine and coastal biota. Mercury bioaccumulates along estuarine-marine food chains, usually resulting in higher concentrations in tissues of top predators, and posing a risk to both marine mammals and human who consume these fish. The Goiana River Estuary (7.5° S) is a typical estuary of the semi-arid tropical regions, and is generally considered to be well preserved. It supports traditional communities with fisheries (mollusks, fish and crustacean) and some commercial enterprises as tourist business.
Materials and methods Trichiurus lepturus (Actinopterygii: Perciformes) is a pscivorous species which belongs to the ecological guild of the marine stragglers. Fish from this species (n=104) were captured in a trapping barrier used by the local traditional population, and using an otter trawl net along the main channel of the low estuary, during two dry seasons (D1 = November, December 2005, January 2006; D2 = November, December 2006, January 2007) and the end of a rainy season (R = August, September, October 2006). Fish muscle samples were preserved cold, and then freeze-dried prior to analysis of its total mercury contents. Total mercury (Hg-T) was determined by cold vapour atomic absorption spectrometry (CV-AAS) with sodium borohydride as a reducing agent. 
Results Weight (x = 204.1 ± 97.9 g; total biomass = 21 229.7g) and total length (x = 63.1 ± 10.1 cm; range 29.5 - 89.0 cm ) showed that the studied group (n = 104) of individuals was composed of sub-adult (30 - 70cm; 71 ind.) and adult fish (>70cm; 33 ind.). DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Living and non-living resources exploitation in a tropical semi-arid estuary
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Living and non-living resources exploitation in a tropical semi-arid estuary

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Tropical estuaries have provided living and non-living resources to human communities for millennia. Today, they are still directly responsible for the maintenance of traditional communities all over the world. Usually, these communities do not rely on a single resource, but exploit a number of them according to family history, seasonal availability and market demands. This study has the objective to identify the spatial and temporal patterns of natural resources exploitation along a topical semi-arid estuarine ecocline. Tropical estuaries on the borders of semi-arid regions, as the Goiana Estuary (Northeast Brazil), show a strong seasonal pattern determined by rainfall (<50mm in dry season and >400mm in rainy season). Consequently, resources availability in terms of access, quantity and quality, follow the same pattern. Spatial changes along the estuarine ecocline also determine resources exploitation patterns. The estuarine ecocline was divided in different habitats in terms of salinity gradient and position in relation to the main channel. Water parameters were measured along the main channel and stakeholders and forms of use the natural resources were noted into a presence/absence manner. The main estuarine habitats located in the upper, middle and lower estuary (main channel, tidal channel, mangrove forest creeks, mangrove forest, and sand/mud flats) and adjacent coastal waters (sand beaches sea grass meadows and reefs) along this continuum provide different resources and ecological services for the traditional communities inhabiting its margins. More recently, non-traditional stakeholders (sugarcane plantations, aquaculture, dredging for sand and tourism) have also come into play in the use of estuarine resources and services. New land and water uses have strongly influenced changes observed along the estuarine ecosystem. Ecological and social fragility have both increased, threatening biological diversity, fisheries production and the preservation of traditio
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Tropical estuaries have provided living and non-living resources to human communities for millennia. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Resuspend intertidal microphytobenthos as major diet component of planktivorous Atlantic Anchoveta Cetengraulis edentulus (Engraulidae)from equatorial mangrove creeks

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Interação entre os Organismos Marinhos e os Parâmetros Ambientais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
In the present study we examined the stomach contents of 49 Atlantic anchoveta, Cetengraulis edentulus (Engraulidae),
caught with a block net from intertidal mangrove creeks at diurnal neap tides between June and September 1997
near Bragança (Pará, northern Brazil). On average the fish had eaten 0.53 % ± 0.35 SD of their wet weight, with fuller
stomachs in June/July. Cetengraulis edentulus is a phytoplanktivorous filter-feeder. The principal food was composed of
about half pelagic and half benthic diatoms, predominantly within a 20 to 200 μm size range. Coscinodiscus, other centric
diatoms, and Nitzschia were abundant in the diet throughout the sample period. Sediment particles and detritus were also
ingested. Our observations suggest that foraging occurs close to the substrate and throughout the water column in shallow
turbid waters. The study indicates the importance of intertidal microphytobenthos production during low tide being
made available to transient planktivorous fish at high tide by tidal resuspension. Atlantic anchoveta may occupy a central
position in the food web of many Neotropical mangrove ecosystems along the Atlantic coast. Its close association with
mangroves may partially explain its irregular distribution between Mexico and southern Brazil.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Movement patterns of catfishes (Ariidae) in a tropical semi-arid estuary

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Interação entre os Organismos Marinhos e os Parâmetros Ambientais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: From December 2005 to November 2006, two hundred and sixteen samples were taken from the main channel of the Goiana Estuary, representing a total sampled area of 23 ha. The Ariidae species were the most abundant in density 1600 individuals ha-1 (53%) and biomass 18 kg ha-1 (63%). The species Cathorops spixii was the most abundant in density (1340 individuals ha-1) and biomass (14 kg ha-1). The variables number of species, total density and biomass showed significant interactions between the factors areas and seasons (p < 0.01). The highest total density (7394 individuals ha-1) and biomass (70 kg ha-1) occurred in the middle and upper estuaries, respectively, during the early rainy season. The density of C. spixii differed significantly among areas and seasons (p < 0.01), while C. agassizii differed significantly only among seasons (p < 0.01). The biomass differed significantly for the species C. spixii, C. agassizii and Sciades herzbergii among seasons, and C. spixii and C. agassizii among areas. Also, the density and biomass of C. spixii and C. agassizii showed interactions among areas and seasons. Only the biomass of S. herzbergii showed interactions among areas and seasons (p < 0.01). This indicates that the seasonal variations influenced the distribution of Ariidae species in the different areas of the Goiana Estuary. Moreover, CCA highlighted a high significant correlation (p < 0.01) between the seasonal variations of the environmental gradients (salinity and water temperature) and distribution of marine catfishes. The management and conservation of these areas, should take into account the life cycle of these species across both estuarine areas and hydrological seasons.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Fish and aquatic habitat conservation in South America: a continental overview with emphasis on neotropical systems

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Fish conservation in South America is a pressing issue. The biodiversity of this group, just as it happens with all other groups of plants and animals, is far from to be fully known. Still, habitat loss may be resulting in biodiversity losses even before it is fully known. In this work the main river basins of South America (Magdalena, Orinoco, Amazon and Paraná/La Plata system), together with key aquatic habitats (mangrove fringed estuaries of the tropical humid, tropical semi-arid and sub-tropical regions) are analyzed in terms of their potentialities and main concerns. Habitat loss was the main concern identified for all South American ecosystems approached here. It may be happening in the form of river damming, deforestation, water pollution, mining, poor agricultural practices or inadequate management practices, for example. It is also pointed out that habitat loss has a direct consequence, which is decrease in living resources availability, a serious social and economic issue, especially for developing countries as all South American Nations. The introduction of exotic species and over fishing were also identified as widespread across the continent and its main freshwater, coastal and marine ecosystems. Finally, suggestions are made to find ways to overcome these problems. The main suggestion is a change of paradigm and a new design of conservation actions, starting with integrated research and aiming at the coordinated and harmonized management of the main transboundary waters of the continent. The actions would be focused on habitat conservation and social rescue of the less attended populations of native and non-native peoples. Energy and freshwater demands will also have to be rescaled in order to control habitat loss.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Moon phases influence on fish assemblages at estuarine mangrove tidal creeks

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Interação entre os Organismos Marinhos e os Parâmetros Ambientais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The influence of the different moon phases on the composition of fish assemblages in relation to species number and abundance (mass and number) in mangrove tidal creeks of the Goiana Estuary was studied. Significant differences on the composition of fish assemblages during different moon phases were detected. The variable number of species showed a significant difference among moon phases. The species Anchovia clupeoides (number of ind.), Centropomus pectinatus (number of ind. and mass) and Guavina guavina (number of ind.) also showed significant difference among moon phases. During the new moon the catch was higher in relation to number of individuals (32%) and mass (34%). This study suggests the conservation and
restoration of mangrove forest of Goiana Estuary as a priority action to guarantee important living resources.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Distribution Patern of fish in a mangrove estuary

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The present study describes the seasonal changes of the fish species composition in three areas of the main channel of the Caeté River estuary, Brazil. The fish faunas of each habitat differed in density, biomass and species composition. Mean fish density and biomass for the Caeté River estuary channel was 0.25 individuals m−2 and 0.9 g m2, respectively. Analysis of catch data showed that the number and biomass of species, total density and total biomass differed significantly between areas and seasons. In the Caeté estuary, seasonal salinity fluctuations appeared to be the main factor that structured the fish assemblage in the entire estuarine system. At least 85% of the species captured by the artisanal and subsistence fisheries in the Bragantine region required estuarine conditions to complete their life cycle. 
The mangrove forest along the northern Brazilian coast is not flooded during low tide. Nevertheless, many fish species remain in the mangrove forest during this time where a total density of 2.8 ind. m−2 and a total biomass of 17.4 g m−2 were recorded. Myrophis punctatus is the most important species in number (1.7 ind. m−2) and weight (12.7 g m−2). The densities and biomass for the three dominant species (M. punctatus, Poecilia spp. and Gobionellus smaragdus) differ significantly temporally. At high tide, in the mangrove tidal creeks, the species number varies significantly among creeks, and total fish biomass differs significantly among seasons.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Total mercury in the fish Trichiurus lepturus from a tropical estuary in relation to length, weight and season.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The Goiana River Estuary (7º30?S 34º47?W) is a typical estuary of the semi-arid tropical regions. This estuary shelters a rich fauna of fish, crustaceans and mollusks which play an important role in the life of traditional populations. It is also the main
recipient of the effluents from the sugarcane agro-industry and sewage from settlements and villages. Trichiurus lepturus (n = 104), from the Goiana Estuary were examined for total mercury contents during ten months (2005 to 2007) spaning two dry
seasons and part of a rainy season. The studied individuals showed weight (W) (204.1±97.9 g) and total length (TL) (63.1±10.1 cm, range 29.5-89.0 cm) with a significant (p<0.05) correlation. Correlation between TL and Hg-T (r = 0.37286) and between W and Hg-T (r = 0.38212) were positive and significant (p<0.05). Two-way ANOVA (n = 81) showed that TL and W had significant
difference (p<0.05) among seasons. The Hg-T showed differences in relation to the factor season (p<0.05). The correlation between Hg-T and rainfall showed a negative and significant relation (r = -0.56; p<0.05). Rainfall strongly influenced the
bioacumulation of mercury in this species. Dryer months showed relatively higher mercury concentrations than the end of the rainy season. Less rainfall, and consequently less particulate matter and less primary production in the estuary, make mercury more bioavailable. Fish from this estuary are fit for human consumption at all times of the year.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Plastic debris ingestion by marine catfish: an unexpected fisheries impact

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Plastic marine debris is a pervasive type of pollution. River basins and estuaries are a source of plastics pollution for coastal waters and oceans. Estuarine fauna is therefore exposed to chronic plastic pollution. Three important catfish species [Cathorops spixii (N=60), Cathorops agassizii (N=60) and Sciades herzbergii (N=62)] from South Western Atlantic estuaries were investigated in a tropical estuary of the Brazilian Northeast in relation to their accidental ingestion of plastic marine debris. Individuals from all three species had ingested plastics. In C. spixii and C. agassizii, 18 and 33% of individuals had plastic debris in their stomachs, respectively. S. herzbergii showed 18% of individuals were contaminated. All ontogenetic phases (juveniles, sub-adults and adults) were contaminated. Nylon fragments from cables used in fishery activities (subsistence, artisanal and commercial) played a major role in this contamination. These catfish spend their entire life cycles within the estuary and are an important feeding resource for larger, economically important, species. It is not yet possible to quantify the scale and depth of the consequences of this type of pollution. However, plastics are well known threat to living resources in this and other estuaries. Conservation actions will need to from now on to take plastics pollution into consideration.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Using gut contents to assess foraging patterns of juvenile green turtles Chelonia mydas in the Paranaguá Estuary, Brazil
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Using gut contents to assess foraging patterns of juvenile green turtles Chelonia mydas in the Paranaguá Estuary, Brazil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This study investigated use of the Paranaguá Estuary as a foraging habitat by juvenile
green turtles Chelonia mydas (L.) by comparing gut contents to available vegetal resources within the estuary. Between June 2004 and July 2007, the carcasses of 80 juvenile green turtles (carapace length range 29 to 73 cm) were found stranded (n = 71) or captured (n = 9) in fishing nets. The digestive tracts of 76 turtles contained food contents which were quantified (ml) and identified (e.g. algae, seagrass, mangrove propagules, mangrove vegetation and shells). Anthropogenic debris was classified
by material, colour and size. Green turtles fed primarily on Halodule wrightii (42.9% of total volume), other vegetal resources (Ulva spp.: 6.7%; Avicennia shaueriana propagules: 10.1%) and other items (37.9%); ingested animal matter was seldom recorded (2.4%). The occurrence and/or availability of vegetal resources were assessed throughout the year. H. wrightii was ingested more frequently
during the early rainy season, when the index of importance in the diet was higher (feeding index, FI: 97.3). Ulva spp. was ingested principally in the late dry season and A. shaueriana propagules in the late rainy season (FI: 23.9 and 12, respectively), when H. wrightii was not available. Anthropogenic debris was frequently ingested (69.7% of individuals), and was especially important in the late rainy season (FI: 60.3). This study highlights the importance of sheltered ecosystems such as the Paranaguá
Estuary and adjacent regions in providing shelter, feeding grounds and resting areas for juvenile green turtles.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Plastic buried in the inter-tidal plain of a tropical estuarine ecosystem.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Plastics have become the most important marine contaminant of the XXI Century. Benthic fauna is not frequently a concern, but can ingest plastics which suffered fragmentation and chemical contamination accumulated in the sediments. This work approaches the amounts and types of plastic buried in the sediments of an intertidal plain on the Northeast coast of Brazil. During one seasonal cycle, 450 samples of sediment were taken. Sediments were sieved (1mm mesh). Thirty-eight plastic fragments of different sizes and types occurred distributed in space and time. Plastics size varied from 1mm to 160cm2. All plastics were heavily weatherized. Soft plastics, nylon and hard plastics items were found. The most likely sources of these plastics are the river basin, the communities that inhabit the margins of the estuary, fishery activities and the mangrove forest. A significant difference between the rainy and dry seasons was detected for the amount and type of plastic found (plastic or nylon) among three sampling areas. Nearer to the mangrove forest there was a larger accumulation of plastic items. This estuary is undergoing an intense process of aggradation and there is a possibility of dredging of the main channel and harbor areas. This, plus the disposal of spoils will further spread the plastics once buried. The dredged areas will become a secondary source of plastics as their pollution burden will be, once more, exposed to tidal currents and main channel flow.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Mercury in tropical and sub-tropical coastal environments.
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Mercury in tropical and sub-tropical coastal environments.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Anthropogenic activities influence the biogeochemical cycles of mercury, both
 qualitatively and quantitatively, on a global scale from sources to sinks. Anthropogenic
 processes that alter the temporal and spatial patterns of sources and cycling processes are changing the impacts of mercury contamination on aquatic biota and humans. Human exposure to mercury is dominated by the consumption of fish and products from aquaculture operations. The risk to society and to ecosystems from mercury contamination is growing, and it is important to monitor these expanding risks. However, the extent and manner to which anthropogenic activities will alter mercury sources and 60 biogeochemical cycling in tropical and sub-tropical coastal environments is poorly understood. Factors as (1) lack of reliable local/regional data; (2) rapidly changing environmental conditions; (3) governmental priorities and; (4) technical actions from supra-national institutions, are some of the obstacles to overcome in mercury cycling research and policy formulation. In the tropics and sub-tropics, research on mercury in 3 the environment is moving from an exploratory 65 ?inventory? phase towards more process oriented studies. Addressing biodiversity conservation and human health issues related to 7 mercury contamination of river basins and tropical coastal environments are an integral part of paragraph 221 paragraph of the United Nations document ?The Future We Want? issued in Rio de Janeiro in June 2012.

In the tropics and sub-tropics, research on mercury in 3 the environment is moving from an exploratory 65 ?inventory? phase towards more process oriented studies. Addressing biodiversity conservation and human health issues related to 7 mercury contamination of river basins and tropical coastal environments are an integral part of paragraph 221 paragraph of the United Nations document ?The Future We Want? issued in Rio de Janeiro in June 2012.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Early development of marine catfishes (Ariidae): from mouth brooding to the release of juveniles in nursery habitats
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Early development of marine catfishes (Ariidae): from mouth brooding to the release of juveniles in nursery habitats

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The development and allometric growth patterns of the ariid catfishes Cathorops spixii and C. agassizii were studied from neurula embryos to juveniles. The ontogenetic sequence revealed that prior to hatching, embryos of both species are well developed, and their axial and appendicular skeletons are well ossified. Embryos of both species grow slowly longitudinally, but positively allometric growth (growth coefficient, β1>1) was observed in head width and eye diameter. It is hypothesized here that these growth patterns might be related to functional priorities for the development of sensory organs, such as the inner ears (otoliths), the Weberian apparatus, eyes, and nostrils, during the embryonic period. The first appearance of vertebrae and otoliths, as well as the ossification of otoliths and the Weberian apparatus, occur earlier in embryos of C. agassizii than in embryos of C. spixii. After hatching, mouth-brooded free embryos of both species grow isometrically. Negatively allometric growth was observed in head width and eye diameter during the yolk-sac period, which is expected given that the sensory organs are already formed. Free embryos of C. agassizii are distinguishable from those of C. spixii by their larger eyes [Diameter, Ø = 1.80 mm ± 0.20 (6.6 % LT) vs. 1.50 mm ± 0.10 (5.2 % LT)], longer snouts [1.20 mm ± 0.20 (4.4 % LT) vs. 1 mm ± 0.30 (3.5 % LT)], longer heads [5.30 mm ± 0.90 (19.5 % LT) vs. 4.60 mm ± 0.70 (15.9 % LT)] and heavier yolk sacs (0.13 g ± 0.03 vs. 0.10 g ± 0.03) (Mann-Whitney, P < 0.01). The end of the yolk-sac period is characterised by a direct change from free embryo to juvenile, without a true larval period. The juveniles of the two species can also be distinguished from each other by the larger eyes of C. agassizii [Ø = 3.30 mm ± 1.00 (12.1 % LT)] compared with C. spixii [Ø = 2.70 mm ± 0.70 (9.4 % LT)] (Mann-Whitney, P < 0.01) such as in adult fishes.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The development and allometric growth patterns of the ariid catfishes Cathorops spixii and C. agassizii were studied from neurula embryos to juveniles.
